questions.question: What is the law of excluded middle?
questions.explanation: Law: p or not p always true. Foundation: classical logic. Implication: complete coverage. Proof: truth table shows. Application: proof by cases. Controversy: intuitionistic logic rejects. Importance: classical reasoning base.

questions.question: What is the law of non-contradiction?
questions.explanation: Law: can't have p and not p. Foundation: logical consistency. Implication: mutual exclusivity. Proof: truth table shows. Application: consistency check. Importance: essential principle. Aristotle: foundational law.

questions.question: What is the conditional law?
questions.explanation: Law: implication converts to negation or consequent. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: eliminate conditionals. Importance: transformation rule. Usage: SAT solving.

questions.question: What is the biconditional law?
questions.explanation: Law: biconditional is mutual implication. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: decompose biconditionals. Importance: transformation rule. Usage: definition formalization.

questions.question: What is the contrapositive law?
questions.explanation: Law: implication equivalent to contrapositive. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table shows. Application: alternate proofs. Importance: reasoning principle. Usage: proof by contrapositive.

questions.question: What is the exportation law?
questions.explanation: Law: conjunction exported to conditional. Equivalence: both formulas same. Proof: truth table verification. Application: formula transformation. Importance: conditional manipulation. Usage: proof techniques.

questions.question: What is the commutative law for biconditional?
questions.explanation: Law: biconditional commutes. Equivalence: both directions true. Proof: truth table shows. Application: reordering. Importance: basic property. Implication: bidirectional equivalence.

questions.question: What is the associative law for biconditional?
questions.explanation: Law: biconditional associates. Equivalence: both groupings true. Proof: truth table shows. Application: multiple biconditionals. Importance: basic property. Note: requires all same truth value.

questions.question: What is the transitive law?
questions.answer: If pq and qr then pr
questions.explanation: Law: chaining implications valid. Validity: sound principle. Proof: from definitions. Application: logical chains. Importance: reasoning foundation. Example: 'If study then pass, if pass then graduate'.

questions.question: What is material implication?
questions.explanation: Implication: pq true except when p true, q false. Basis: formal logic. Alternative: subjunctive conditional. Controversy: vacuous truth counterintuitive. Importance: standard interpretation.
